body.name: Total by Verizon Motorola moto g Power (2021), 64GB, Black - Prepaid Smartphone (Locked)
body.stockDetail: Only 1 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 14 hrs 32 mins
features: Carrier: This phone is locked to Total by Verizon, which means this device can only be used on the Total by Verizon wireless network.
Turn up the wow factor with features you won't believe like a 5,000mAh battery that provides power for up to three days.
A 6.5" Max Vision HD+ 90Hz display with a top of the line refresh rate, and a mystifying 50MP main camera that won't miss a thing.
Compatible with our no-contract talk, text & data plans that start at $30/mo.
body.description: The possibilities are endless with the new moto g Power (2021) from Total by Verizon. Go longer on a single charge with up to 3 days of battery life (1). Enjoy seamless performance with a 90Hz refresh rate powered by the MediaTek G37 Hello processor that also improves mobile experience across the board. Capture and store everything with a 50MP camera system and 64GB (2) internal storage expandable with microSD cards up to 512GB (3). Get a premium wireless experience without the premium price tag or costly long-term contracts with Unlimited talk, text & high-speed data plans from Total by Verizon that start at just $30/mo for a single line. Access the fastest speeds with Verizon and enjoy special perks like hotspot capability, international long-distance calling, and exclusive discounts, everything on the network America relies on. (1) All battery life claims are approximate and based on the median user tested across a mixed use profile (which includes both usage and standby time) under optimal network conditions. Actual battery performance will vary and depends on many factors including signal strength, network and device settings, temperature, battery condition, and usage patterns. (2) Available user storage is less due to many factors, including operating system, software and functions utilizing part of this capacity; may change with software updates. (3) Supports up to 512GB microSD card, microSD cards sold separately. Content with DRM restrictions may not be able to be moved to the card.Plan Matrix and Rewards disclaimers:*Refer to the latest Terms and Conditions of Service at Total by Verizon Website. At 2G Speeds, the functionality of some data applications, such as streaming audio or video may be affected. If congested, customers may notice reduced speeds vs carrier postpaid customers.‡ Refer to the latest Terms and Conditions of Service at Total by Verizon Website. If congested, customers may notice reduced speeds vs carrier postpaid customers.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 3.8 3.8 out of 5 stars 74 ratings 3.8 out of 5 stars

productInformation.name: Included Components
productInformation.value: User Manual, Service Guide, Charger, USB Cable

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best cheap phone on the market.
reviews.reviewText: This phone has a long lasting battery. It has three or four gigabytes of RAM and a fairly decent processor. Out of all the phones you can buy I think this one has the best value for the money and I've been using them for years now. When this phone breaks I'll just buy another one exactly like it. Since it's a Motorola phone it has karate chop flashlight. All you have to do is make a karate chop motion with the phone and the light turns on and that's pretty awesome. A twisting motion will quickly access your camera for pictures or videos. The pictures are not the best but it's not something that is very important to me in the pictures I've taken have been fine. If you really care for that sort of thing you should get a really expensive phone. Look no further. This is the good simple phone that you need. My favorite part is that when I'm on a boat and I dropped my phone into the Gulf of Mexico I can just laugh because it really is no big deal at this price. When I smash my screen I have a chuckle and reorder another one before the screen is unusable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I am not a phone enthusiast. I don't need frills. I mainly make calls, text, listen to music and watch YouTube. For that reason, I only purchase budget phones with prepaid plans. So far I love this phone. At this point the main reason I can give is speed. This phone is so much quicker than my last several budget phones. The camera is also better than my last several budget phones. I wasn't expecting much but I am very happy with my purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Never Worked & Still Charged! Refund Fail!
reviews.reviewText: Ordered Two Phones for my husband & I. Both phones NEVER worked so we Returned them AND WERE REFUNDED for 1 NOT BOTH PHONES!!! And of course NO customer service to actually HELP!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for what I wanted.
reviews.reviewText: Cheap. Huge battery. Decent GPS. These aren't getting used as phones. Little bitty hand held computer with a GPS. Works very well for that. Ample storage for mapping apps and map storage. The compass is a bit janky but just keep moving and the GPS will correct that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Checks all the boxes
reviews.reviewText: Great phone for the money, android lovers. Battery life is impressive. Camera much improved frome Motorola G Pure phone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not as good.....and Not a 2021model
reviews.reviewText: I shattered the screen on my previous 2021 Moto G power I ordered this as an "exact" replacement (listed as the same 2021 power) Well, what I received was the 2022 Moto G power. One might be inclined to think this was a good thing? Not so, or at least for me this model is much more...."Glitchy" and less user friendly. Don't get me wrong is basically the same phone and I'm sure overtime I would adjust to the few differences. However, after having the phone just 2 days the phone started slowing way down...I mean a very noticeable difference from the first 1/2 day (I was waiting for the it to say "Do you want to play a game?")Worse is about 2 hours ago the phone started an android update and has not stopped shutting down and each time it comes on it says "update is complete" ten mins later...repeat....repeat....etc it repeats the message in the attached pic after each restart? I'm starting the return now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Took off 2 stars cuz one is defective
reviews.reviewText: Purchased 2 phones. One for me and one for husband. My phone is great. But after one week my husband's phone started experiencing sound problems. Didn't want to try to return it because we had already set it up and transferred phone number and service from old phone to this one . It would have meant having to transfer everything back to old phone while waiting for a replacement and then transferring everything again to replacement phone. Just very disappointed that this happened. Thankfully it wasn't very expensive. Hopefully I won't have the same problem with mine. I love mine. Have had it for 2 months now. So far so good.Fingers crossed 🤞

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2023
